Feedback List: You started the consultation with an open question. This will help build rapport and allow the patient to share their concerns.

You started the consultation with a closed question. Although it is appropiate to used closed questions to identify what the patient has taken, they can also impeed rapport. It is prefereble to use open questions initially to allow the patient to share their concerns.
In order to clarify what the patient had taken and how much you used closed questions. This was an appropriate use of closed questions to gather this specific information.

Following your initial closed question the patient seemed uncommunicative and you asked multiple further closed questions to establish what she had taken.  Asking more open questions initially may make her feel more comfortable allowing you to return to these questions later and recieve more informative responses.
You identified some of the precipitants to the overdose. This will inform you formulation and risk assessment
You found out about Ms Smith's current feelings about self harm. Asking about current thoughts of suicide or self harm is essential. It will inform your risk assessment.
